snippet: A pending civil suit against MBIA, an insurer of mortgage-backed securities, may illuminate the misbehavior of the financial industry before and during the downturn.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column observes that a pending civil suit against MBIA, an insurer of mortgage-backed securities, may illuminate the misbehavior of the financial industry before and during the downturn; contends trial, and the ones that could follow it, will not change extent of losses due to bad loans during the boom, but are likely to affect the division of the losses; points out that for those who watch them, they will also document just how irresponsible, or worse, many of the players were.
lead_paragraph: A pending civil suit against MBIA, an insurer of mortgage-backed securities, may illuminate the misbehavior of the financial industry before and during the downturn.

headline.print_headline: An Industry’s Failure To Verify, After Trusting
